text.code:
Usage
  $ alinea <command> [options]
Available Commands
  generate    Generate types and content cache
  init        Copy a sample config file to the current directory
  serve       Start a development dashboard
For more info, run any command with the `--help` flag
  $ alinea generate --help
  $ alinea init --help
Options
  -v, --version    Displays current version
  -h, --help       Displays this message

content.text: Creates an example config file. Run once during setup.
The generate command indexes content and generates the `@alinea/generated` package. It's recommended to run it as part of the build step in your project.

text.code:
Options
  -w, --watch     Watch for changes to source files
  -c, --config    Location of the config file, defaults to "alinea.config.tsx"
  --fix           Any missing or incorrect properties will be overwritten by their default

content.text: Starts a development server to display the alinea dashboard. It can be prepended to another development command to run it in parallel.

text.code:
// Example: start the dashboard and next development server
alinea serve -- next dev

Options
  -p, --port      Port to listen on
  --production    Use production backend
